title.value: Pre-Training and Fine-Tuning Generative Flow Networks
title.justification: Title found at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Pre-Training and Fine-Tuning Generative Flow Networks

extractions.description: This paper introduces a novel method for the reward-free pre-training of Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) called the outcome-conditioned GFlowNet (OC-GFN). The authors demonstrate how these pre-trained models can be efficiently fine-tuned for diverse downstream tasks with new reward functions. Experimental results validate the efficacy and efficiency of this approach across various domains including GridWorld and biological sequence design tasks.

type.justification: The paper proposes a novel theoretical approach to GFlowNet training and fine-tuning, although there are extensive empirical validations.
type.quote:
In this paper, we propose a novel method for reward-free unsupervised pre-training of GFlowNets. We formulate the problem of pre-training GFlowNets as a self-supervised problem of learning an outcome-conditioned GFlowNet (OC-GFN) which learns to reach any outcome (goal)
as a functional understanding of the environment (akin to goal-conditioned RL (Chebotar et al.,
2021)).

primary_research_field.justification: The research focuses on Generative Flow Networks, which is a subfield within deep learning.
primary_research_field.quote: In this paper, we propose a novel method for reward-free unsupervised pre-training of GFlowNets.

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper discusses Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) which are used to generate diverse sets of high-reward objects.
sub_research_fields.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) are amortized samplers that learn stochastic policies to sequentially generate compositional objects from a given unnormalized reward distribution.

name.justification: Specifically mentioned as the key model introduced in the paper.
name.quote: We propose a novel method for reward-free unsupervised pre-training of GFlowNets. We formulate the problem of pre-training GFlowNets as a self-supervised problem of learning an outcome-conditioned GFlowNet (OC-GFN).

caracteristics.justification: The paper explicitly mentions that OC-GFN is a type of Generative Flow Network that is outcome-conditioned.
caracteristics.quote: We propose a novel method for reward-free unsupervised pre-training of GFlowNets. We formulate the problem of pre-training GFlowNets as a self-supervised problem of learning an outcome-conditioned GFlowNet (OC-GFN).

name.justification: The dataset is used for evaluating the proposed pre-training and fine-tuning strategy.
name.quote: Extensive experimental results validate the efficacy of our approach, demonstrating the effectiveness of pre-training the OC-GFN... on the GridWorld domain.

name.justification: TF Bind is utilized to show the applicability of OC-GFN in biological sequence design.
name.quote: Through extensive experiments on the GridWorld domain, we empirically validate the efficacy of the proposed pre-training and fine-tuning paradigm. We also demonstrate its scalability to larger-scale and challenging biological sequence design tasks, which achieves consistent and substantial improvements over strong baselines, especially in terms of diversity of the generated samples.

name.justification: RNA Sequence dataset is used to illustrate the effectiveness in generating RNA sequences for binding targets.
name.quote: A GFlowNet can be trained to generate candidate RNA sequences.

name.justification: The Adam optimizer is mentioned as part of the training setup for the models.
name.quote: We train all models with the Adam (Kingma and Ba, 2015) optimizer (learning rate is 0.001) based on samples from a parallel of 16 rollouts in the environment.
